meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ignoble.
meanings.sent1: The ignobility of his actions was evident to all.
meanings.sent2: She was ashamed of the ignobility of her behavior.
meanings.sent3: Despite his ignobility, he somehow managed to charm everyone.
meanings.sent4: The ignobility of the situation left a bitter taste in her mouth.
meanings.sent5: The ignobility of the crime shocked the entire community.

meanings.sent1: The soldier's ignobility was a stain on his reputation.
meanings.sent2: The ignobility of the act was condemned by all.
meanings.sent3: His ignobility in the face of danger surprised his comrades.
meanings.sent4: The ignobility of the decision haunted him for years.
meanings.sent5: The ignobility of the betrayal was unforgivable.

meanings.sent1: The ignobility of his betrayal cut deep.
meanings.sent2: She was shocked by the ignobility of his lies.
meanings.sent3: His ignobility in cheating during the game was obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The ignobility of his greed knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The ignobility of his actions tarnished his reputation forever.
